channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Lisa Murkowski Isn’t Using ‘Nice Words’ About Life Under Trump
item.description: The Alaska Republican senator has no qualms about criticizing the president. She could play a make-or-break role in pushing back on the legislation ca...

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs has the inside track on friend Jony Ive’s collaboration with OpenAI—but still wants to see Apple succeed
item.description: Ive says a driver for the io-OpenAI design is the fact that "humanity deserves better" than an "uneasy" relationship with technology.

item.title: Gen Z men studying an MBA will see a 75% salary bump—that’s 25% more than women with the same qualification
item.description: Male MBA graduates make $36,000 more than their female counterparts and the disparity begins with their first job out of school.

item.title: The transformation of women’s sports in Saudi Arabia is no mirage. Just ask the women
item.description: Women were barred from stadiums prior to 2018. Today, there’s a premier women’s soccer league with global sponsorships.

item.title: Attack in Boulder, Colorado, Investigated as Act of Terrorism: What to Know
item.description: Eight people were hospitalized after a man used a “makeshift flamethrower” on a gathering in support of hostages in Gaza. The authorities are investig...

item.title: In Drone Attacks on Russia, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
item.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

item.title: Syrian stock exchange reopens after a 6-month hiatus as part of U.S.-led push for a new free market economy
item.description: Stock trading resumed in Damascus after a six-month pause that began in December.

item.title: Chime chases $11 billion valuation in IPO set for next week on Nasdaq
item.description: Crypto firm Circle is also going public with goals of a $7.2 billion valuation.

item.title: Heavy Rain and Severe Storms Expected to Sweep Across Central U.S.
item.description: Damaging winds and large hail are forecast for the Plains and the Midwest, and the remnants of Tropical Storm Alvin could bring excessive rainfall and...

item.title: In Drone Attacks on Russia, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
item.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

item.title: Poland’s Presidential Election Result Highlights Trump-Europe Divide
item.description: The country’s government is centrist, with deep ties to Brussels. Its new president is a Trump-backed nationalist. That reflects a broader struggle.

item.title: What imports the U.S. relies on most from each country.
item.description: The item from each country that makes up the largest American import share.
